intro: Siphoboea, commonly known as the silverleaf siphoboea, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. These plants are native to regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where they thrive in coastal and rocky habitats. They are characterized by their small, delicate flowers that often have a striking silver or white hue. Siphoboea species typically have narrow, leathery leaves and produce small, fleshy fruits. Due to their ornamental value and unique appearance, some species are cultivated in gardens, though they are not widely grown outside their native range.
